question:
When using minimize() for regression, which of the following objective functions would cause the model to shift towards the outliers to a greater extent than the rest:
a: (y_pred - y)^2
b: (y_pred - y)
c: |ypred - y|

answers.answer: All will equally affect the model

question: Which of the following is a linear regression model:
A linear regression model which can correctly generalise the trend in the data has

answers.answer: lowest possible sum squared errors but not necessarily zero

question: Regression is a useful method to find a model which generalizes a data set because

answers.answer: It provides parameters which can have physical significance
It can help to identify the important variables affecting a system
It is not a black-box model

question:
Which of the following statements are true:
Linear regression is limiting because:
a: It assumes a linear relationship between the variables which may not always be the case
b: It is affected by outliers
c: It is overly simplistic and would always fit to noisy observations

initial_guess = [a0, b0, c0, d0]
pars, pcov = curve_fit(func, x, y, p0=initial_guess)

What is the variance for the parameter 'c'?
An increase in the number of measurements (data points) will result in

answers.answer: Narrower confidence intervals for the average value
An increase in the uncertainty of the average value
Broader confidence intervals for the average value
No effect on the confidence intervals

question: Monte Carlo Propagation of Errors has a limited reliability because

answers.answer: It assumes the parameters are drawn from a normal distribution
It assumes that the parameter errors are independent of each other

question:
Calculate the degrees of freedom for the model:
y = 5 + x1 + 10x2 + 5x3;
if we have 10 sample data points
